availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Brother (Bath County, Kentucky, laborer and farmer)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, laborer and farmer. Maryland native. Married to Elvira Vece Brother in Bath County, Kentucky, on July 22, 1829. Father of James M. Brother. Laborer in Woodford County, Kentucky, in 1850. Farmer in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, District 2, p. 497A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 54.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Owingsville, p. 51A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bath County Marriages, Film 000273007.
